alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 2:12AM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from half an inch to five inches. North to northwest winds sustained at 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph resulting in near blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE... Sherman, Cheyenne and Rawlins counties in Kansas and Dundy and Hitchcock counties in Nebraska. * WHEN...Beginning late tonight and ending by sunset Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with snow, blowing snow and breezy to strong north winds. Locally heavy snow and blizzard conditions are possible, at times, Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bands of precipitation, initially in the form of rain, will rapidly develop across portions of the advisory area through this morning. Precipitation is anticipated to transition from rain to snow between 2 AM and 4 AM MST as breezy to strong north winds usher a colder airmass into the region. Locally heavy snow and blizzard conditions are possible at times, mainly between 4 AM and 11 AM MST Sunday morning, when the majority of precipitation is anticipated to occur. Conditions may vary considerably from county to county, or even within the same county.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
